comments.author: Kathryn
comments.content: This looks delicious. We've recently become hooked on harissa paste so this will be pinned and made very soon. I'm sure using store bought gluten free pasta won't be the same as your beautiful homemade version but I'm sure it will still be wonderful.

comments.author: Lisa
comments.content: Oh wow, wow, wow, this looks amazing!

comments.author: Jan
comments.content: Really looks amazing... definitely will try some of these.

comments.author: Maria Tadic
comments.content: This looks so good!  I love harissa and am always looking for new ways to cook with it.  I will definitely be trying this recipe!

comments.author: jenn
comments.content: I totally agree with your overly-steamed broccoli view. Some people seem to steam their vegetables into a liquid form, so gross. Nice tip about pan roasting the broccoli, that sounds much tastier than a light steam :)

comments.author: Jen
comments.content: Made this for dinner tonight and it was fantastic. I had no fresh herbs or cavatelli (or a cavatelli maker, for that matter) so I used plain old spaghetti and added salt-preserved oranges (about a quarter teaspoon of finely minced rind). Superb!

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Ooh, preserved oranges sounds great in this.

comments.author: Ben Martin
comments.content: Just made a variation with mushrooms, whole wheat fusilli, and frozen broccoli. Slow roasting like this really helped the frozen broccoli. Yum.

comments.author: Julia
comments.content: I made this tonight with broccolini and it was delicious. I really appreciated the delicate complimentary flavors and the cooking method kept a perfect crisp to the broccolini. I served it with coconut quinoa and tofu. Thanks for posting!

comments.author: Carl
comments.content: Can you suggest an alternative to Harissa that would still give the dish some flavor and spice? I don't have access to Harissa.....

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: You can make your own harissa, here's a good basic recipe: http://www.bonappetit.com/recipes/slideshows/2009/05/how_to_make_harissa

comments.author: Chris Kimm
comments.content: We made this tonight - a ridiculously cold night in February - with gluten free pasta (brown rice based). We dug it! Next time we might up the amount of harissa for a little more heat, but the flavors are terrific. Yum!
